cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest over the east-central Gulf, forecast to turn northeast on Wednesday and cross the southeastern United States, then emerge off the mid-Atlantic coast and accelerate northeastward over the western Atlantic toward Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / Big Bend near Panama City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to the northeastern Gulf Coast (Alabama/Florida border west to Mississippi)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; storm-surge watch Tampa Bay southward
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from Alabama/Florida border to Florida Big Bend; then inland across GA-SC-NC and off the Mid-Atlantic/New England coastline
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated 6-inch totals mentioned for southern New England coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 30-40 mph possible as storm passes offshore Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft possible along the NY/NJ shoreline and back bays as the cyclone passes offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain band of 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts could affect the port late Thursday into Friday, creating flash-flood potential and operational slow-downs
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; minor coastal flooding of low-lying terminals and approaches
